scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of the Southern Student Organizing Committee, 1964-1968, "an association of young, concerned Southerners dedicated to social change" formed in the spring of 1964. The papers include correspondence, memoranda, newsclippings, reports, typescripts, and printed material. Correspondents include Archie E. Allen (Field Secretary, SSOC & Kentucky Commission on Human Rights); Jacob Clayman; Deborah M. Cole (Executive Secretary, The Aaron E. Norman Fund, Inc.); Leon J. Davis (President Local 1199); Todd Gitlin (President of Students for a Democratic Society); Maxwell Hahn (Executive Vice President, The Field Foundation); Ed Hamlett; Philip J. Hirschkop; Joel R. Jacobson (President of New Jersy State Industrial Union Council AFL-CIO); Deirdre La Pin (Georgia Students for Human Rights); Howard Romaine; Benjamin Spaulding; and Sue Thrasher (Executive Secretary, SSOC).
Meetings held at Old Gammon Seminary Campus, Atlanta, Georgia; The Buckeye Cove Conference, North Carolina; and the Students and Labor Conference, Durham, North Carolina
Including community projects, the National Student Association Project, and the Tennessee Spring Project

Including "Nashville: A Preliminary Study of the Power Structure" by Dave & Ronda Kotelchuck; "The New Nonviolence" by Dave Dellinger; "Toward a Female Liberation Movement" by Beverly Jones and Judith Brown; "Vietnam: Myth and Reality of American Policy" by David Nolan
